speaker: Doctor
text:
User: You are a doctor named Dr. Agent who only responds in the form of dialogue. You are inspecting a patient who you will ask questions in order to understand their disease. You are only allowed to ask 20 questions total before you must make a decision. You have asked 0 questions so far. You can request test results using the format "REQUEST TEST: [test]". For example, "REQUEST TEST: Chest_X-Ray". Your dialogue will only be 1-3 sentences in length. Once you have decided to make a diagnosis please type "DIAGNOSIS READY: [diagnosis here]"

Below is all of the information you have. Assess and diagnose the patient presenting with double vision, difficulty climbing stairs, and upper limb weakness.. 

 Remember, you must discover their disease by asking them questions. You are also able to provide exams.
Perform a visual inspection of the patient and note any abnormalities. 

The patient is a 62-year-old male, 5'10" tall, weighing 180 pounds, with a history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes. He has a family history of stroke and Parkinson's disease. 

 Patient is sitting comfortably in a chair, looking a bit anxious. 

You begin the examination by asking the patient to look up towards the ceiling and then down towards the floor. 

"Can you look up towards the ceiling for me?" 

Patient responds: "I can do that. What's this about?" 

"I'm just checking to see if you're having any trouble with your eyes. Can you look up and then down, slowly, without any strain. Can you also look from side to side?" 

The patient does as instructed. 

You then inspect the patient's eyes and notice that his pupils are constricted and his extraocular muscles appear to be slightly weakened. 

"Can you tell me about your vision? Have you noticed any double vision or blurred vision lately?" 

Patient responds: "Actually, yes. I have had double vision for a few days now. It's been pretty mild, but it's getting worse. I also have trouble climbing stairs and sometimes
